name: Annie Daneault
body: 13 JANUARY 30, 2019 2019-13 1. Under paragraph 2(1)(b) and subsection 3(2) of the Labour and Employment Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Geoffrey Bladon, Keswick Ridge, New Brunswick, as Vice-Chair of the Labour and Employment Board, for a term of three years, effective February 19, 2019. 2) Under paragraph 2(1)(b) and subsection 3(2) of the Labour and Employment Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Annie Daneault, Grand Falls, New Brunswick, as Vice-Chair of the Labour and Employment Board, for a term of three years, effective April 10, 2019. 3. Under paragraph 2(1)(c) and subsection 3(2) of the Labour and Employment Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as employee members of the Labour and Employment Board, for terms of three years, effective January 30, 2019: (a) Jacqueline Bergeron-Bridges, Eel River Crossing, New Brunswick; (b) Debbie Gray, Quispamsis, New Brunswick; (c) Pamela Guitard, Bathurst, New Brunswick; (d) Richard MacMillan, St. Stephen, New Brunswick; and (e) Gary Ritchie, Fredericton, New Brunswick. 4. Under paragraph 2(1)(c) and subsection 3(2) of the Labour and Employment Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as employer members of the Labour and Employment Board, for terms of three years, effective January 30, 2019: 13 (a) | Gerald Cluney, Moncton, New Brunswick; (b) William Dixon, Moncton, New Brunswick; and (c) | Marco Gagnon, Grand Falls, New Brunswick. body: 39 FEBRUARY 28, 2019 2019-39 1. Under subsection 3(1) of the Executive Council Act and section 3 of the Civil Service Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Jean-Marc Dupuis as Clerk of the Executive Council, Head of the Public Service and Chief Operating Officer, effective March 4, 2019, in place of Judy Wagner. 2. Under subsection 3(1) of the Executive Council Act and section 3 of the Civil Service Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Judy Wagner as Deputy Minister of Policy and Legislative Affairs, in addition to her current duties as Secretary to Cabinet, effective March 4, 2019. 3. name: Cheryl Johnson
body: 41 MARCH 14, 2019 2019-41 i. Under subsection 30(1) of the Mental Health Act and subsection 17.2(1) of New Brunswick Regulation 94-33, the General Regulation — Mental Health Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons to the Mental Health Review Boards, for a term of five years, effective March 14, 2019: (a) Cheryl Johnson, Quispamsis, New Brunswick, as an alternate chair of the Mental Health Review Board for the South (Zones 1, 2,3 and 7); (b) Kayla Carter, Moncton, New Brunswick, as an alternate chair of the Mental Health Review Board for the South (Zones 1, 2, 3 and 7); (c) Shelley Dumouchel, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as an alternate chair of the Mental Health Review Board for the South (Zones 1, 2,3 and 7); (d) Dr. Sergiy Ostashko, Miramichi, New Brunswick, as a member (psychiatrist) of the Mental Health Review Board for the North (Zones 4, 5 and 6); (e) Rina Arsenault, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Mental Health Review Board for the South (Zones 1, 2, 3 and 7); (f) Luc Blacquiére, Sud Tetagouche, New Brunswick, as a member of the Mental Health Review Board for the North (Zones 4, 5 and 6); and (g) Thérése Roy, Dieppe, New Brunswick, as an alternate member of the Mental Health Review Board for the South (Zones 1, 2, 3 and 7). , 41 2; Under subsection 30(1) of the Mental Health Act and subsection 17.2(1) of New Brunswick Regulation 94-33, the General Regulation — Mental Health Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Lucie Robichaud, Baie du Petit-Pokemouche, New Brunswick, as an alternate member of the Mental Health Review Board for the North (Zones 4, 5 and 6), for a term of five years, effective March 14, 2019. 3. Under subsection 7.5(1) of the Mental Health Act and subsections 8(1), 8(2) and 8(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 94-33, the General Regulation — Mental Health Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as Chairs of the Mental Health Tribunal (North and South), for five-year terms, effective March 14, 2019: (a) Donald Cullinan, Saint John, New Brunswick; (b) | George Cooper, Moncton, New Brunswick; (c) Rosemary Losier, Miramichi, New Brunswick; and (d) | Gary Mclaughlin, Edmundston, New Brunswick. Under subsection 30(1) of the Mental Health Act and subsection 17.2(1) of New Brunswick Regulation 94-33, the General Regulation — Mental Health Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons to the Mental Health Review Boards, for a term of five years, effective March 14, 2019: (a) Cheryl Johnson, Quispamsis, New Brunswick, as an alternate chair of the Mental Health Review Board for the South (Zones 1, 2,3 and 7); (b) Kayla Carter, Moncton, New Brunswick, as an alternate chair of the Mental Health Review Board for the South (Zones 1, 2, 3 and 7); (c) Shelley Dumouchel, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as an alternate chair of the Mental Health Review Board for the South (Zones 1, 2,3 and 7); (d) Dr. Sergiy Ostashko, Miramichi, New Brunswick, as a member (psychiatrist) of the Mental Health Review Board for the North (Zones 4, 5 and 6); (e) Rina Arsenault, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Mental Health Review Board for the South (Zones 1, 2, 3 and 7); (f) Luc Blacquiére, Sud Tetagouche, New Brunswick, as a member of the Mental Health Review Board for the North (Zones 4, 5 and 6); and (g) Thérése Roy, Dieppe, New Brunswick, as an alternate member of the Mental Health Review Board for the South (Zones 1, 2, 3 and 7). , 41 2; Under subsection 30(1) of the Mental Health Act and subsection 17.2(1) of New Brunswick Regulation 94-33, the General Regulation — Mental Health Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Lucie Robichaud, Baie du Petit-Pokemouche, New Brunswick, as an alternate member of the Mental Health Review Board for the North (Zones 4, 5 and 6), for a term of five years, effective March 14, 2019. 3. Under subsection 7.5(1) of the Mental Health Act and subsections 8(1), 8(2) and 8(4) of New Brunswick Regulation 94-33, the General Regulation — Mental Health Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as Chairs of the Mental Health Tribunal (North and South), for five-year terms, effective March 14, 2019: (a) Donald Cullinan, Saint John, New Brunswick; (b) | George Cooper, Moncton, New Brunswick; (c) Rosemary Losier, Miramichi, New Brunswick; and (d) | Gary Mclaughlin, Edmundston, New Brunswick. Under subsections 56.5(1) and 56.5(5) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Maya Hamou, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as an Emergency Adjudicative Officer, for a term of ten years, effective May 9, 2019. 3. Under subsections 56.1 { 1) and 56.1(5) of the Judicature Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Maya Hamou, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a Case Management Master, for a term of three years, effective May 9, 2019. 4. Under subsection 18(1) of the Small Claims Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes paragraphs {j), {n) and {dd) of Order in Council 2012-362, dated November 21, 2012. 5. body: 93 MAY 16, 2019 2019-93 1. Under paragraph 11(1)(a) and subsections 11(2) and 12(1) of the Service New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the following persons as member of the Board of Directors of Service New Brunswick, for three-year terms, effective May 16, 2019: (a) Donald Moore, Moncton, New Brunswick; and (b) Karen 0. Taylor, Woodstock, New Brunswick. 2. Under section 14 of the Service New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Louise Duguay Lepage, Edmundston, New Brunswick, as Vice-Chair of the Board of Directors of Service New Brunswick, effective May 16, 2019, for a term ending January 1, 2021. 3. Under section 14 of the Service New Brunswick Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints Karen 0. Taylor, Woodstock, New Brunswick, as Chair of the Board of Directors of Service New Brunswick, for a three-year term, effective May 16, 2019. J.C. Under subsections 9(1) and (2) of the Film and Video Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Shelley Roach Dumouchel, Fredericton, New Brunswick as an adjudicator to conduct hearings, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 2. Under subsections 9(1) and (2) of the Film and Video Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Bernard T. LeBlanc, Moncton, New Brunswick as an adjudicator to conduct hearings, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 3. Under subsections 9(1) and (2) of the Film and Video Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Liza Anne Robichaud, Bathurst, Fredericton, New Brunswick as an adjudicator to conduct hearings, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 4. Under subsection 31 ( 1) of the Gaming Control Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Shelley Roach Dumouchel, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as an adjudicator under the Gaming Control Act, for the purpose of conducting· hearings, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 5. Under subsection 31 (1) of the Gaming Control Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Bernard T. LeBlanc, Moncton, New Brunswick, as an adjudicator under the Gaming Control Act, for the purpose of conducting hearings, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 6. Under subsection 31(1) of the Gaming Control Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Liza Anne Robichaud, Bathurst, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as an adjudicator under the Gaming Control Act, for the purpose of conducting hearings, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 107 - 2 7. name: Brigitte Ouellette
body: 108 JUNE 6, 2019 2019-108 Under subsections 2(2) and 3(2) of the Assessment and 1. Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Brigitte Ouellette, Grand-Sault, New Brunswick, as Vice-Chair of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, for a term of five years, effective June 17, 2019. 2. Under paragraph 2(1 )(b) and subsection 3(3) ofthe Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Michel Vautour, Saint-Ignace, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region Two, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 3. Under paragraph 2( 1 )(b) and subsection 3(3) ofthe Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Carole Beaulieu, Saint-Jacques, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region Ten, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 4. Under paragraph 2(1 )(b) and subsection 3(3) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Gerard Robichaud, Neguac, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region Four, for a term of three years, effective July 10, 2019. 5. Under paragraph 2(1 )(b) and subsection 3(3) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints David F. Hildebrand, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region Nine, for a term of three years, effective July 10, 2019. 108 -2 6. Under paragraph 2(1 )(b) and subsection 3(3) ofthe Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Paul 8. DeMerchant, Florenceville-Bristol, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region Eleven, for a term of three years, effective July 10, 2019. 7. Under paragraph 2(1 )(b) and subsection 3(3) ofthe Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Micheline Hachey, North Tetagouche, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region Three, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 8. Under paragraph 2( 1 )(b) and subsection 3(3) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Gilda rd Chiasson, Shippagan, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region Three, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 9. Under paragraph 2(1 )(b) and subsection 3(3) ofthe Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Cleveland Allaby, St. Andrews, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region Eight, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 10. Under subsections 3(3) and 9( 1) ofthe Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Pierre Brine, Dieppe, New Brunswick, as alternate member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region One, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 11. Under subsections 3(3) and 9(1) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Joanne Plourde, Edmundston, New Brunswick, as alternate member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region Ten, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 108 -3 12. Under paragraph 2(1)(b) and subsection 3(3) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 3 of Order in Council 2017 172 dated July 10, 2017. 13. Under subsections 3(3) and 9(1) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council revokes section 9 of Order in Council 2017-172 dated July 10, 2017. J.C. body: 108 JUNE 6, 2019 2019-108 Under subsections 2(2) and 3(2) of the Assessment and 1. Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Brigitte Ouellette, Grand-Sault, New Brunswick, as Vice-Chair of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, for a term of five years, effective June 17, 2019. 2. DeMerchant, Florenceville-Bristol, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region Eleven, for a term of three years, effective July 10, 2019. 7. Under paragraph 2(1 )(b) and subsection 3(3) ofthe Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Micheline Hachey, North Tetagouche, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region Three, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 8. Under paragraph 2( 1 )(b) and subsection 3(3) of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Gilda rd Chiasson, Shippagan, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region Three, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 9. Under paragraph 2(1 )(b) and subsection 3(3) ofthe Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Cleveland Allaby, St. Andrews, New Brunswick, as a member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region Eight, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 10. Under subsections 3(3) and 9( 1) ofthe Assessment and Planning Appeal Board Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Pierre Brine, Dieppe, New Brunswick, as alternate member of the Assessment and Planning Appeal Board, representing Region One, for a term of three years, effective June 6, 2019. 11. Under subsection 9(1) of the New Brunswick Liquor Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Patrick Parent, Rothesay, New Brunswick, as President of the New Brunswick Liquor Corporation, for a term of five years, effective September 3, 2019. 2. Under subsections 7(1) and 7(2) of the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the following persons to the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation Board of Trustees: (a) Mel Parker, Campbellton, New Brunswick, trustee from the public at large, for a term of three years, effective September 9, 2019; (b) Tim Ringuette, Saint John, New Brunswick, trustee from the public at large, for a term of three years, effective September 9, 2019; (c) Charlaine Gauthier, Moncton, New Brunswick, trustee from the public at large, for a term of three years, effective July 10, 2019; (d) Barbara Jessome, Edmundston, New Brunswick, trustee from the public at large, for a term of three years, effective July 10, 2019; and (e) Bernard Bourque, Wilson's Beach, New Brunswick, trustee representing the New Brunswick Public Libraries Board, effective September 9, 2019, for a term ending March 31, 2021. 2. Under subsection 7(3) of the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council designates Marianne Mallia, Upper Kingsclear, New Brunswick, as Chair of the New Brunswick Public Libraries Foundation Board, effective September 9, 2019 for a term ending June 5, 2021. name: Alina M. Anghel
body: 177 OCTOBER 3, 2019 2019-177 1. Under section 182.1 of the Liquor Control Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints the following employees of the Laboratory in Scientific Services Directorate of the Canada Border Services Agency as provincial analysts, for a term of five years, effective October 3, 2019: (a) Alina M. Anghel, Ottawa, Ontario; (b) | Frangois Breton, Ottawa, Ontario; (c) Cindy Carrier, Ottawa, Ontario; (d) Jessica Diano, Nepean, Ontario; (e) | Camilo Augusto Quintero, Ottawa, Ontario; (f) Kara Rutter Swiecki, Ottawa, Ontario; and (g) | Dorthy Vernon, Ottawa, Ontario. 2. Under section 26 of the Interpretation Act and section 182.1 of the Liquor Control Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes the following paragraphs of Order in Council 2010-254 dated May 13, 2010: (a) subparagraph 2(a)(i); (b) subparagraph 2(a)(iii); (c) subparagraph 2(a)(v); (d) subparagraph 2(a)(vi); (e) subparagraph 2(a)(vii); and (f) paragraph 2(b); Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d'un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 3 October 2019. Deputy retary to Cabinet / Secrétaire adjointe du Cabinet ‘eliwces atu MP Keeps 177 2. En vertu de l'article 26 de la Loi d'interprétation et de l'article 182.1 de la Loi sur la réglementation des alcools, le lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil révoque les alinéas et sous-alinéas suivants du décret en conseil 2010- 254 pris le 13 mai 2010: a) sous-alinéa 2a)(i); b) sous-alinéa 2a)(iii); c) sous-alinéa 2a)(v); d) sous-alinéa 2a)(vi); e) sous-alinéa 2a)(vii); et f) alinéa 2b). La lieutenante-gouverneure, Renate Maroy Brenda L. Murphy This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d'un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 3 octobre 2019. en to Cabinet / Secrétaire adjointe du Cabinet thiten Lrewn NKh ye

name: Annette Comeau
body: 181 OCTOBER 3, 2019 2019-181 al, Under paragraph 7(1)(a) and subsections 9(1) and 9(2) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as members of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, for a term of three years, effective October 3, 2019: (a) | Cathy LaRochelle, Fredericton New Brunswick; and (b) Kelli Simmonds, Fredericton, New Brunswick. 2. Under paragraph 7(1)(b) and subsections 9(1) and 9(2) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as members of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, effective October 3, 2019: (a) Annette Comeau, Fredericton, New Brunswick, for a term of two years; (b) David Rogers, Florenceville-Bristol, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; (c) Meaghan Seagrave, Fredericton, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; (d) Irene McCardle, Miramichi, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; and (e) Dr. Levi Hargrove, Chicago, Illionois, United States of America, for a term of two years. 181 3 Under paragraph 7(1)(b) and subsections 9(1), 9(2) and 11(1) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Dr. Shelley Rinehart, Saint John, New Brunswick, as a member and Chair of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, for a term of three years, effective October 3, 2019. 4. Under subsection 11(1) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Janet Gagnon, Fredericton New Brunswick, as a member and Vice-Chair of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, effective October 3, 2019, for a term ending June 19, 2021. Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 3 October 2019. Deputy Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire adjointe du Cabinet

name: Camilo Augusto Quintero
body: 177 OCTOBER 3, 2019 2019-177 1. Under section 182.1 of the Liquor Control Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints the following employees of the Laboratory in Scientific Services Directorate of the Canada Border Services Agency as provincial analysts, for a term of five years, effective October 3, 2019: (a) Alina M. Anghel, Ottawa, Ontario; (b) | Frangois Breton, Ottawa, Ontario; (c) Cindy Carrier, Ottawa, Ontario; (d) Jessica Diano, Nepean, Ontario; (e) | Camilo Augusto Quintero, Ottawa, Ontario; (f) Kara Rutter Swiecki, Ottawa, Ontario; and (g) | Dorthy Vernon, Ottawa, Ontario. 2. Under section 26 of the Interpretation Act and section 182.1 of the Liquor Control Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes the following paragraphs of Order in Council 2010-254 dated May 13, 2010: (a) subparagraph 2(a)(i); (b) subparagraph 2(a)(iii); (c) subparagraph 2(a)(v); (d) subparagraph 2(a)(vi); (e) subparagraph 2(a)(vii); and (f) paragraph 2(b); Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d'un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 3 October 2019. Deputy retary to Cabinet / Secrétaire adjointe du Cabinet ‘eliwces atu MP Keeps 177 2. En vertu de l'article 26 de la Loi d'interprétation et de l'article 182.1 de la Loi sur la réglementation des alcools, le lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil révoque les alinéas et sous-alinéas suivants du décret en conseil 2010- 254 pris le 13 mai 2010: a) sous-alinéa 2a)(i); b) sous-alinéa 2a)(iii); c) sous-alinéa 2a)(v); d) sous-alinéa 2a)(vi); e) sous-alinéa 2a)(vii); et f) alinéa 2b). La lieutenante-gouverneure, Renate Maroy Brenda L. Murphy This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d'un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 3 octobre 2019. en to Cabinet / Secrétaire adjointe du Cabinet thiten Lrewn NKh ye

name: Cathy LaRochelle
body: 181 OCTOBER 3, 2019 2019-181 al, Under paragraph 7(1)(a) and subsections 9(1) and 9(2) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as members of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, for a term of three years, effective October 3, 2019: (a) | Cathy LaRochelle, Fredericton New Brunswick; and (b) Kelli Simmonds, Fredericton, New Brunswick. 2. Under paragraph 7(1)(b) and subsections 9(1) and 9(2) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as members of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, effective October 3, 2019: (a) Annette Comeau, Fredericton, New Brunswick, for a term of two years; (b) David Rogers, Florenceville-Bristol, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; (c) Meaghan Seagrave, Fredericton, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; (d) Irene McCardle, Miramichi, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; and (e) Dr. Levi Hargrove, Chicago, Illionois, United States of America, for a term of two years. 181 3 Under paragraph 7(1)(b) and subsections 9(1), 9(2) and 11(1) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Dr. Shelley Rinehart, Saint John, New Brunswick, as a member and Chair of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, for a term of three years, effective October 3, 2019. 4. Under subsection 11(1) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Janet Gagnon, Fredericton New Brunswick, as a member and Vice-Chair of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, effective October 3, 2019, for a term ending June 19, 2021. Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 3 October 2019. Deputy Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire adjointe du Cabinet

name: Dorthy Vernon
body: 177 OCTOBER 3, 2019 2019-177 1. Under section 182.1 of the Liquor Control Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints the following employees of the Laboratory in Scientific Services Directorate of the Canada Border Services Agency as provincial analysts, for a term of five years, effective October 3, 2019: (a) Alina M. Anghel, Ottawa, Ontario; (b) | Frangois Breton, Ottawa, Ontario; (c) Cindy Carrier, Ottawa, Ontario; (d) Jessica Diano, Nepean, Ontario; (e) | Camilo Augusto Quintero, Ottawa, Ontario; (f) Kara Rutter Swiecki, Ottawa, Ontario; and (g) | Dorthy Vernon, Ottawa, Ontario. 2. Under section 26 of the Interpretation Act and section 182.1 of the Liquor Control Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes the following paragraphs of Order in Council 2010-254 dated May 13, 2010: (a) subparagraph 2(a)(i); (b) subparagraph 2(a)(iii); (c) subparagraph 2(a)(v); (d) subparagraph 2(a)(vi); (e) subparagraph 2(a)(vii); and (f) paragraph 2(b); Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d'un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 3 October 2019. Deputy retary to Cabinet / Secrétaire adjointe du Cabinet ‘eliwces atu MP Keeps 177 2. En vertu de l'article 26 de la Loi d'interprétation et de l'article 182.1 de la Loi sur la réglementation des alcools, le lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil révoque les alinéas et sous-alinéas suivants du décret en conseil 2010- 254 pris le 13 mai 2010: a) sous-alinéa 2a)(i); b) sous-alinéa 2a)(iii); c) sous-alinéa 2a)(v); d) sous-alinéa 2a)(vi); e) sous-alinéa 2a)(vii); et f) alinéa 2b). La lieutenante-gouverneure, Renate Maroy Brenda L. Murphy This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d'un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 3 octobre 2019. en to Cabinet / Secrétaire adjointe du Cabinet thiten Lrewn NKh ye

name: Harry Gerard Gallant
body: 178 OCTOBER 3, 2019 2019-178 1: Under subsection 2(2) of the Coroners Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints the following individuals as coroners, for a term of three years, effective October 3, 2019: (a) | Denis Desjardins, Edmundston, New Brunswick; (b) | Raoul Gionet, Tide Head, New Brunswick; and (c) Harry Gerard Gallant, Miramichi, New Brunswick. a Yory Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 3 October 2019. Deputy retary to Cabinet / Secrétaire adjointe du Cabinet

name: Hector Losier
body: 182 OCTOBER 3, 2019 2019-182 1. Under paragraphs 8(1)(b), 8(1.03)(a), and subsection 8(2) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following individuals, as worker representatives on the Board of Directors of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission, for a term of three years, effective October 3, 2019: (a) Hector Losier, Fredericton, New Brunswick; and (b) James Stanley, Saint John, New Brunswick. 2. Under paragraphs 8(1)(c) , 8(1.03)(b) and subsection 8(2) of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission and Workers’ Compensation Appeals Tribunal Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Lucien Sonier, Caraquet, New Brunswick, as an employer representative on the Board of Directors of the Workplace Health, Safety and Compensation Commission, for a term of three years, effective October 3, 2019. Puasts Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 3 October 2019. Deputy Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire adjointe du Cabinet

name: Irene McCardle
body: 181 OCTOBER 3, 2019 2019-181 al, Under paragraph 7(1)(a) and subsections 9(1) and 9(2) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as members of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, for a term of three years, effective October 3, 2019: (a) | Cathy LaRochelle, Fredericton New Brunswick; and (b) Kelli Simmonds, Fredericton, New Brunswick. 2. Under paragraph 7(1)(b) and subsections 9(1) and 9(2) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as members of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, effective October 3, 2019: (a) Annette Comeau, Fredericton, New Brunswick, for a term of two years; (b) David Rogers, Florenceville-Bristol, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; (c) Meaghan Seagrave, Fredericton, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; (d) Irene McCardle, Miramichi, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; and (e) Dr. Levi Hargrove, Chicago, Illionois, United States of America, for a term of two years. 181 3 Under paragraph 7(1)(b) and subsections 9(1), 9(2) and 11(1) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Dr. Shelley Rinehart, Saint John, New Brunswick, as a member and Chair of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, for a term of three years, effective October 3, 2019. 4. Under subsection 11(1) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Janet Gagnon, Fredericton New Brunswick, as a member and Vice-Chair of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, effective October 3, 2019, for a term ending June 19, 2021. Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 3 October 2019. Deputy Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire adjointe du Cabinet

name: Jessica Diano
body: 177 OCTOBER 3, 2019 2019-177 1. Under section 182.1 of the Liquor Control Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council appoints the following employees of the Laboratory in Scientific Services Directorate of the Canada Border Services Agency as provincial analysts, for a term of five years, effective October 3, 2019: (a) Alina M. Anghel, Ottawa, Ontario; (b) | Frangois Breton, Ottawa, Ontario; (c) Cindy Carrier, Ottawa, Ontario; (d) Jessica Diano, Nepean, Ontario; (e) | Camilo Augusto Quintero, Ottawa, Ontario; (f) Kara Rutter Swiecki, Ottawa, Ontario; and (g) | Dorthy Vernon, Ottawa, Ontario. 2. Under section 26 of the Interpretation Act and section 182.1 of the Liquor Control Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes the following paragraphs of Order in Council 2010-254 dated May 13, 2010: (a) subparagraph 2(a)(i); (b) subparagraph 2(a)(iii); (c) subparagraph 2(a)(v); (d) subparagraph 2(a)(vi); (e) subparagraph 2(a)(vii); and (f) paragraph 2(b); Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d'un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 3 October 2019. Deputy retary to Cabinet / Secrétaire adjointe du Cabinet ‘eliwces atu MP Keeps 177 2. En vertu de l'article 26 de la Loi d'interprétation et de l'article 182.1 de la Loi sur la réglementation des alcools, le lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil révoque les alinéas et sous-alinéas suivants du décret en conseil 2010- 254 pris le 13 mai 2010: a) sous-alinéa 2a)(i); b) sous-alinéa 2a)(iii); c) sous-alinéa 2a)(v); d) sous-alinéa 2a)(vi); e) sous-alinéa 2a)(vii); et f) alinéa 2b). La lieutenante-gouverneure, Renate Maroy Brenda L. Murphy This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d'un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 3 octobre 2019. en to Cabinet / Secrétaire adjointe du Cabinet thiten Lrewn NKh ye

name: Jim Mehan
body: 179 OCTOBER 3, 2019 2019-179 ‘As Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsections 4(2), 4(3) and 4(4) of the New Brunswick Housing Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints the following persons as directors of the New Brunswick Housing Corporation, effective October 3, 2019, for a term to end March 30, 2021: (a) Leanne Murray, Fredericton, New Brunswick; (b) | Jim Mehan, Quispamsis, New Brunswick; and (c) Libby Macdonald, Fredericton, New Brunswick. 2. Under paragraph 4(1)(c) and subsection 4(2) of the New Brunswick Housing Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes sections 1, 4 and 8 of Order in Council 2018-95 dated March 21, 2018. Bente Wonpty- Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 3 October 2019. ON Nebae, to Cabinet / Secrétaire adjointe du Cabinet

name: Meaghan Seagrave
body: 181 OCTOBER 3, 2019 2019-181 al, Under paragraph 7(1)(a) and subsections 9(1) and 9(2) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as members of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, for a term of three years, effective October 3, 2019: (a) | Cathy LaRochelle, Fredericton New Brunswick; and (b) Kelli Simmonds, Fredericton, New Brunswick. 2. Under paragraph 7(1)(b) and subsections 9(1) and 9(2) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as members of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, effective October 3, 2019: (a) Annette Comeau, Fredericton, New Brunswick, for a term of two years; (b) David Rogers, Florenceville-Bristol, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; (c) Meaghan Seagrave, Fredericton, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; (d) Irene McCardle, Miramichi, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; and (e) Dr. Levi Hargrove, Chicago, Illionois, United States of America, for a term of two years. 181 3 Under paragraph 7(1)(b) and subsections 9(1), 9(2) and 11(1) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Dr. Shelley Rinehart, Saint John, New Brunswick, as a member and Chair of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, for a term of three years, effective October 3, 2019. 4. Under subsection 11(1) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Janet Gagnon, Fredericton New Brunswick, as a member and Vice-Chair of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, effective October 3, 2019, for a term ending June 19, 2021. Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 3 October 2019. Deputy Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire adjointe du Cabinet

name: Shelley Rinehart
body: 181 OCTOBER 3, 2019 2019-181 al, Under paragraph 7(1)(a) and subsections 9(1) and 9(2) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as members of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, for a term of three years, effective October 3, 2019: (a) | Cathy LaRochelle, Fredericton New Brunswick; and (b) Kelli Simmonds, Fredericton, New Brunswick. 2. Under paragraph 7(1)(b) and subsections 9(1) and 9(2) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as members of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, effective October 3, 2019: (a) Annette Comeau, Fredericton, New Brunswick, for a term of two years; (b) David Rogers, Florenceville-Bristol, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; (c) Meaghan Seagrave, Fredericton, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; (d) Irene McCardle, Miramichi, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; and (e) Dr. Levi Hargrove, Chicago, Illionois, United States of America, for a term of two years. 181 3 Under paragraph 7(1)(b) and subsections 9(1), 9(2) and 11(1) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints Dr. Shelley Rinehart, Saint John, New Brunswick, as a member and Chair of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, for a term of three years, effective October 3, 2019. 4. Under subsection 11(1) of the Research and Productivity Council Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Janet Gagnon, Fredericton New Brunswick, as a member and Vice-Chair of the New Brunswick Research and Productivity Council, effective October 3, 2019, for a term ending June 19, 2021. Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 3 October 2019. Under section 672.38 and subsection 672.4(1) of the Criminal Code (Canada), the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Lyne Raymond, Campbellton, New Brunswick as chairperson of the Criminal Code Review Board, for a term of five years, effective October 17, 2019. 2. name: Allison Walker
position: Chair of the Board of Directors
body: 200 OCTOBER 31, 2019 2019-200 1. Under subsections 3(1) and 3(2) of the Kings Landing Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as members of the Board of Directors of the Kings Landing Corporation, effective October 31, 2019: (a) Juan Estepa, Fredericton, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; (b) lan G. Stead, Saint John, New Brunswick, for a term of two years; (c) Helen Jean Newman, Fredericton, New Brunswick, for a term of two years; and (d) Allison Walker, Darlings Island, New Brunswick, for a term of two years. 2. Under subsections 3(1) and 3(2) of the Kings Landing Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister, appoints the following persons as members of the Board of Directors of the Kings Landing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective December 7, 2019: (a) Janice Allen-Scott, Scotch Settlement, New Brunswick: and (b) Karl Clancey, Saint John, New Brunswick. 200 3. Under subsection 3(8) of the Kings Landing Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister, appoints (a) Allison Walker, Darlings Island, New Brunswick, as Chair of the Board of Directors of the Kings Landing Corporation, for a term of two years, effective October 31, 2021; and; (b) Helen Jean Newman, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as Vice- Chair of the Board of Directors of the Kings Landing Corporation, effective December 7, 2019, for a term to expire October 30, 2021. pA Yap Brenda L. name: Donald French
body: 203 OCTOBER 31, 2019 2019-203 1. Under subsection 6(1) of the Financial and Consumer Services Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Donald French, Dieppe, New Brunswick, as a member of the Financial and Consumer Services Commission, effective October 31, 2019, for a term of four years. 2. Under subsection 6(1) of the Financial and Consumer Services Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Norma Kelly, Saint John, New Brunswick, as a member of the Financial and Consumer Services Commission, effective October 31, 2019, for a term of three years. 3. Under subsection 6(1) of the Financial and Consumer Services Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Paul Van lderstine, Moncton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Financial and Consumer Services Commission, effective October 31, 2019, for a term of two years. 4. Under subsection 6(1) of the Financial and Consumer Services Commission Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Marilyn Evans Born, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as a member of the Financial and Consumer Services Commission, effective January 1, 2020, for a term of two years. 203 -2 5. Under subsection 6(1) of the Financial and Consumer Services Commission Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council revokes section 2 of Order in Council 2017-235 dated September 27, 2017. Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui precede est une copie conforme d'un decret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 31 October 2019.

name: Helen Jean Newman
position: Vice-Chair of the Board of Directors
body: 200 OCTOBER 31, 2019 2019-200 1. Under subsections 3(1) and 3(2) of the Kings Landing Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council reappoints the following persons as members of the Board of Directors of the Kings Landing Corporation, effective October 31, 2019: (a) Juan Estepa, Fredericton, New Brunswick, for a term of three years; (b) lan G. Stead, Saint John, New Brunswick, for a term of two years; (c) Helen Jean Newman, Fredericton, New Brunswick, for a term of two years; and (d) Allison Walker, Darlings Island, New Brunswick, for a term of two years. 2. Under subsections 3(1) and 3(2) of the Kings Landing Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister, appoints the following persons as members of the Board of Directors of the Kings Landing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective December 7, 2019: (a) Janice Allen-Scott, Scotch Settlement, New Brunswick: and (b) Karl Clancey, Saint John, New Brunswick. 200 3. Under subsection 3(8) of the Kings Landing Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister, appoints (a) Allison Walker, Darlings Island, New Brunswick, as Chair of the Board of Directors of the Kings Landing Corporation, for a term of two years, effective October 31, 2021; and; (b) Helen Jean Newman, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as Vice- Chair of the Board of Directors of the Kings Landing Corporation, effective December 7, 2019, for a term to expire October 30, 2021. pA Yap Brenda L. Stead, Saint John, New Brunswick, for a term of two years; (c) | Helen Jean Newman, Fredericton, New Brunswick, for a term of two years; and (d) Allison Walker, Darlings Island, New Brunswick, for a term of two years. 2} Under subsections 3(1) and 3(2) of the Kings Landing Corporation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister, appoints the following persons as members of the Board of Directors of the Kings Landing Corporation, for a term of three years, effective December 7, 2019: (a) | Janice Allen-Scott, Scotch Settlement, New Brunswick; and (b) Karl Clancey, Saint John, New Brunswick. 200 3. Under subsection 3(8) of the Kings Landing Act, the Lieutenant- Governor in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister, appoints (a) Allison Walker, Darlings Island, New Brunswick, as Chair of the Board of Directors of the Kings Landing Corporation, for a term of two years, effective October 31, 2019; and; (b) | Helen Jean Newman, Fredericton, New Brunswick, as Vice- Chair of the Board of Directors of the Kings Landing Corporation, effective December 7, 2019, for a term to expire October 30, 2021. A Yep Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 31 October 2019. name: Cade Libby
body: 224 NOVEMBE7R, 2019 2019-224 1. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Jean-Marc Dupuis as Secretary to Cabinet, effective September 16, 2019, in place of Judy Wagner. 2. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Kelly Cain as Deputy Minister of Intergovernmental Affairs, effective November 12, 2019, in place of Héléne Bouchard. 3. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Marcel Lavoie as Deputy Minister of Education and Early Childhood Development (Francophone), effective November 12, 2019, in place of Gérald Richard. 4. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints George Daley as Deputy Minister of Education and Early Childhood Development (Anglophone), effective November 12, 2019, in place of John McLaughlin. 5. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Gérald Richard as Deputy Minister of Health, effective November 12, 2019, in place of Tom Maston. 224 6: Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act and section 27 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Cade Libby as Acting Deputy Minister of Aboriginal Affairs, effective November 12, 2019, in place of Judy Wagner. the Under section 3 of the Regional Development Corporation Act and section 27 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Cade Libby as Acting President of the Regional Development Corporation, effective November 12, 2019, in place of Héléne Bouchard. 8. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act and section 27 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints John P. Logan, as Acting Deputy Minister of Transportation and Infrastructure, effective November 12, 2019, in place of Kelly Cian. 9. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act and sections 26 and 27 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council amends section 3 of Order in Council 2017-304 dated November 22, 2017, by striking out the word “Acting” where it appears therein. ante Mpty Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 7 November 2019. Deputy Secretary to Cabinet / Secrétaire adjointe du Cabinet Piliuia, Gun Okénpe

Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Gérald Richard as Deputy Minister of Health, effective November 12, 2019, in place of Tom Maston. 224 6: Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act and section 27 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Cade Libby as Acting Deputy Minister of Aboriginal Affairs, effective November 12, 2019, in place of Judy Wagner. the Under section 3 of the Regional Development Corporation Act and section 27 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints Cade Libby as Acting President of the Regional Development Corporation, effective November 12, 2019, in place of Héléne Bouchard. 8. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act and section 27 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council appoints John P. Logan, as Acting Deputy Minister of Transportation and Infrastructure, effective November 12, 2019, in place of Kelly Cian. 9. Under section 3 of the Civil Service Act and sections 26 and 27 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council amends section 3 of Order in Council 2017-304 dated November 22, 2017, by striking out the word “Acting” where it appears therein. ante Mpty Brenda L. Murphy Lieutenant-Governor This is to certify that the foregoing is a true copy of an Order of the Lieutenant-Governor in Council of the Je certifie que le document qui précéde est une copie conforme d’un décret du lieutenant-gouverneur en conseil Province of New Brunswick, made on the de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, pris le 7 November 2019. name: Tanya Cooper
body: 259 DECEMBER 19, 2019 2019-259 1. Under section 6 of the Municipal Elections Act, section 36.3 of the Education Act, section 11 of N.B. Regulation 2012-7, the Board Regulation - Regional Health Authorities Act and section 26 of the Interpretation Act, the Lieutenant-Governor in Council revokes section 2 of Order in Council 2015-292 dated December 17, 2015 and section 2 of Order in Council 2016-3 dated January 12, 2016, effective December 19, 2019. 2. Under section 6 of the Municipal Elections Act, section 36.3 of the Education Act, and section 11 of New Brunswick Regulation 2012-7, the Board Regulation- Regional Health Authorities Act, the Lieutenant Governor in Council appoints the following persons as municipal returning officers, for the 2020 municipal general elections, as well as any by-elections for municipalities that may be required in their respective regions, effective December 19, 2019: (a) Richard Ayles, Campbellton, New Brunswick, Region M01 Restigouche; (b) Mark Guindon, Bathurst, New Brunswick, Region M02 Bathurst and Area; (c) Delcia Cool, Le Goulet, New Brunswick, Region M03 Acadian Peninsula; (d) Cyril Donahue, Miramichi, New Brunswick, Region M04 Northumberland; (e) Clarence Melanson, St-Antoine Sud, New Brunswick, Region M05 Kent-Westmorland; (f) Tanya Cooper, Hillsborough, New Brunswick, Region M06 Albert-Westmorland; (g) O'Neil Arseneau, Dieppe, New Brunswick, M07 Moncton; (h) Victorine Robichaud, Rothesay, New Brunswick, MOS King- Queens; 259 - 2 (i) Terry Totten, Saint John, New Brunswick, M09 Saint John; (j) Mary Casement, St. Andrews, New Brunswick, M10 Charlotte; (k) Patti Nason, Tracy, New Brunswick, M11 Queens-Sunbury-York; (I) Blake Kennedy, Rusagonis, New Brunswick, M12 Fredericton; (m) Lori Ann Tweedie, Williamstown, New Brunswick, M13 Carleton- Victoria; and (n) Lore-Ann Carroll, St-Leonard-Parent, New Brunswick, M14 Madawaska.
